intro: Arethusa sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese evergreen or the dragon blood tree, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces a red, resinous sap that has been used in traditional medicine and as a dye. Arethusa sinensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its unique appearance and historical significance make it a notable species in botanical studies.
